summary: This is a subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to J.P. Morgan Chase Bank, commanding the bank to appear in court on November 29, 2021, to authenticate records produced pursuant to a grand jury subpoena in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: Issued the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which the subpoena was issued to authenticate bank records.

events.title: Court Appearance for Records Custodian
events.description: J.P. Morgan Chase Bank is commanded to appear in court to have a records custodian authenticate certain records produced pursuant to a grand jury subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued to J.P. Morgan Chase Bank to authenticate records in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
The subpoena demands a records custodian appear in court on November 29, 2021.
The records were produced by J.P. Morgan pursuant to a grand jury subpoena.
Failure to comply constitutes contempt of court and subjects the bank to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
